t: Luke 16
The Parable of the Shrewd Manager
Jesus*p told his disciples: “There*r was*r a*r rich*r man*r whose*r manager*r was*r accused*r of*r wasting*r his*r possessions.*r

So*r he*r called*r him*r in*r and*r asked*r him,*r ‘What*r is*r this*r I*r hear*r about*r you?*r Give*r an*r account*r of*r your*r management,*r because*r you*r cannot*r be*r manager*r any*r longer.’*r
“The*rp manager*r said*r to*r himself,*r ‘What*r shall*r I*r do*r now?*r My*r master*r is*r taking*r away*r my*r job.*r I’m*r not*r strong*r enough*r to*r dig,*r and*r I’m*r ashamed*r to*r beg—*r
I*r know*r what*r I’ll*r do*r so*r that,*r when*r I*r lose*r my*r job*r here,*r people*r will*r welcome*r me*r into*r their*r houses.’*r
“So*rp he*r called*r in*r each*r one*r of*r his*r master’s*r debtors.*r He*r asked*r the*r first,*r ‘How*r much*r do*r you*r owe*r my*r master?’*r
“ ‘Nine*rp hundred*r gallons*r of*r olive*r oil,’*r he*r replied.*r “The*rp manager*r told*r him,*r ‘Take*r your*r bill,*r sit*r down*r quickly,*r and*r make*r it*r four*r hundred*r and*r fifty.’*r

“Then*rp he*r asked*r the*r second,*r ‘And*r how*r much*r do*r you*r owe?’*r “ ‘A*rp thousand*r bushels*r of*r wheat,’*r he*r replied.*r “He*rp told*r him,*r ‘Take*r your*r bill*r and*r make*r it*r eight*r hundred.’*r

“The*rp master*r commended*r the*r dishonest*r manager*r because*r he*r had*r acted*r shrewdly.*r For*r the*r people*r of*r this*r world*r are*r more*r shrewd*r in*r dealing*r with*r their*r own*r kind*r than*r are*r the*r people*r of*r the*r light.*r
I*r tell*r you,*r use*r worldly*r wealth*r to*r gain*r friends*r for*r yourselves,*r so*r that*r when*r it*r is*r gone,*r you*r will*r be*r welcomed*r into*r eternal*r dwellings.*r

“Whoever*rp can*r be*r trusted*r with*r very*r little*r can*r also*r be*r trusted*r with*r much,*r and*r whoever*r is*r dishonest*r with*r very*r little*r will*r also*r be*r dishonest*r with*r much.*r
So*r if*r you*r have*r not*r been*r trustworthy*r in*r handling*r worldly*r wealth,*r who*r will*r trust*r you*r with*r true*r riches?*r
And*r if*r you*r have*r not*r been*r trustworthy*r with*r someone*r else’s*r property,*r who*r will*r give*r you*r property*r of*r your*r own?*r

“No*rp one*r can*r serve*r two*r masters.*r Either*r you*r will*r hate*r the*r one*r and*r love*r the*r other,*r or*r you*r will*r be*r devoted*r to*r the*r one*r and*r despise*r the*r other.*r You*r cannot*r serve*r both*r God*r and*r money.”*r
The*p Pharisees, who loved money, heard all this and were sneering at Jesus.

He said to them, “You*r are*r the*r ones*r who*r justify*r yourselves*r in*r the*r eyes*r of*r others,*r but*r God*r knows*r your*r hearts.*r What*r people*r value*r highly*r is*r detestable*r in*r God’s*r sight.*r
Additional Teachings

“The*rp Law*r and*r the*r Prophets*r were*r proclaimed*r until*r John.*r Since*r that*r time,*r the*r good*r news*r of*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r is*r being*r preached,*r and*r everyone*r is*r forcing*r their*r way*r into*r it.*r
It*r is*r easier*r for*r heaven*r and*r earth*r to*r disappear*r than*r for*r the*r least*r stroke*r of*r a*r pen*r to*r drop*r out*r of*r the*r Law.*r
“Anyone*rp who*r divorces*r his*r wife*r and*r marries*r another*r woman*r commits*r adultery,*r and*r the*r man*r who*r marries*r a*r divorced*r woman*r commits*r adultery.*r
The Rich Man and Lazarus
“There*rp was*r a*r rich*r man*r who*r was*r dressed*r in*r purple*r and*r fine*r linen*r and*r lived*r in*r luxury*r every*r day.*r
At*r his*r gate*r was*r laid*r a*r beggar*r named*r Lazarus,*r covered*r with*r sores*r
and*r longing*r to*r eat*r what*r fell*r from*r the*r rich*r man’s*r table.*r Even*r the*r dogs*r came*r and*r licked*r his*r sores.*r
“The*rp time*r came*r when*r the*r beggar*r died*r and*r the*r angels*r carried*r him*r to*r Abraham’s*r side.*r The*r rich*r man*r also*r died*r and*r was*r buried.*r
In*r Hades,*r where*r he*r was*r in*r torment,*r he*r looked*r up*r and*r saw*r Abraham*r far*r away,*r with*r Lazarus*r by*r his*r side.*r

So*r he*r called*r to*r him,*r ‘Father*r Abraham,*r have*r pity*r on*r me*r and*r send*r Lazarus*r to*r dip*r the*r tip*r of*r his*r finger*r in*r water*r and*r cool*r my*r tongue,*r because*r I*r am*r in*r agony*r in*r this*r fire.’*r

“But*rp Abraham*r replied,*r ‘Son,*r remember*r that*r in*r your*r lifetime*r you*r received*r your*r good*r things,*r while*r Lazarus*r received*r bad*r things,*r but*r now*r he*r is*r comforted*r here*r and*r you*r are*r in*r agony.*r

And*r besides*r all*r this,*r between*r us*r and*r you*r a*r great*r chasm*r has*r been*r set*r in*r place,*r so*r that*r those*r who*r want*r to*r go*r from*r here*r to*r you*r cannot,*r nor*r can*r anyone*r cross*r over*r from*r there*r to*r us.’*r
“He*rp answered,*r ‘Then*r I*r beg*r you,*r father,*r send*r Lazarus*r to*r my*r family,*r
for*r I*r have*r five*r brothers.*r Let*r him*r warn*r them,*r so*r that*r they*r will*r not*r also*r come*r to*r this*r place*r of*r torment.’*r
“Abraham*rp replied,*r ‘They*r have*r Moses*r and*r the*r Prophets;*r let*r them*r listen*r to*r them.’*r
“ ‘No,*rp father*r Abraham,’*r he*r said,*r ‘but*r if*r someone*r from*r the*r dead*r goes*r to*r them,*r they*r will*r repent.’*r
“He*rp said*r to*r him,*r ‘If*r they*r do*r not*r listen*r to*r Moses*r and*r the*r Prophets,*r they*r will*r not*r be*r convinced*r even*r if*r someone*r rises*r from*r the*r dead.’ ”*r
